ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right Hemisphere Pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Marked left ear deficits on dichotic tasks and bilateral frequency pattern deficits that did not improve with humming.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Corpus Callosum Dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to pattern deficits, but ruled out because humming response did not improve scores.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional CAPD
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial working diagnosis before medical imaging revealed structural atrophy.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate central auditory processing abilities given academic struggles.
Investigated in adulthood due to onset of seizures.
Investigated in adulthood to identify structural causes for seizures and auditory deficits.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing was normal. Central testing revealed a classic right hemisphere pattern: marked left ear deficits on dichotic tasks and bilateral deficits on frequency patterns with no improvement during humming conditions.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Thresholds within the normal range bilaterally.

tests.name: Frequency Patterns
tests.result_summary: Abnormal bilaterally (~0-5%) with no improvement during humming condition.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up testing showed some maturational improvement, but the specific pattern of left ear dichotic deficits and poor frequency pattern perception persisted.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Thresholds remained within the normal range bilaterally.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Medical workup in adulthood following seizure onset confirmed right hemisphere pathology consistent with earlier audiological findings.

tests.name: EEG
tests.result_summary: Abnormal spiking over right temporal and parietal lobes.

tests.name: MRI Head
tests.result_summary: Atrophy of the right hemisphere, predominantly involving the right temporal and parietal lobes.

proposed_items: Preferential seating to bias acoustic input to the right ear
Improvement of educational acoustics in the classroom
counseling_actions: Teaching strategies to signal awareness for important information
Counseling regarding the nature of the central auditory deficit

red_flags_present: Marked left ear deficit on dichotic tasks
Bilateral deficits in Frequency Pattern perception with no humming improvement

escalation.rationale_short: Marked central auditory deficits strongly implicated neurological pathology; medical evaluation was warranted.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor functional progress and medical status.

expected_outcome: Patient graduated from high school with a modified curriculum.
Patient works primarily as a laborer.
Developed mild partial seizures involving twitching of the left arm in adulthood.
MRI confirmed atrophy of the right hemisphere, predominantly involving the right temporal and parietal lobes.
EEG showed abnormal spiking over right temporal and parietal lobes.
